From: Eric Vought <evought@...>

You can also add logging to your code. We have a testcase which
automatically collects and organizes the log output from the
class-under-test. You can just tail the log file or add some
code to the GUI testrunner to display it. Apache/Jakarta has a nice
logging system. We also have our own package (http://qcijutils.qlue.com)
whcih includes a LoggerTestCase base class. If you use our package,
check out the latest source. LoggerTestCase is not in the last binary jar.

On Mon, 15 Oct 2001, Chris Eppstein wrote:

> We send this kind of info to stdout on my project. A better abstraction
> would be very nice so that which ever runner is used it could be displayed
> as appropriate in that environment.... I know that JsUnit provides this with
> a debug() method but I haven't seen anything like this for JUnit.
>
> Chris
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Daniel Reynes [mailto:daniel.reynes@...]
> Sent: Monday, October 15, 2001 2:36 AM
> To: Junit
> Subject: [junit] Writing a text in TestRunner
>
>
> Hello,
>
> During my test with TestRunner, I would like to write something in the
> result panel so that I can see the progression of the tests.
> Is there a kind of Assert.. which can do this, without stopping tests ?
>
> Thank you in advance
>
> Dan
